ACCEPTANCE_STATEMENT_CONTENT: (FR)I acknowledge that it is my responsibility to read and understand the information contained within each heading presented on this page.
FAQ_LINK_THREE: (FR)What you need to know to file your report
FAQ_LINK_ONE_CONTENT:
(FR)Once you have successfully completed your online reporting session, you will be advised when you should submit your next report. It is important to submit your reports as soon as they are due or your report may not be processed.

If your report is incomplete it will not be accepted for processing. In a few circumstances you will need to speak with us to complete your report. If this is the case, you will be given instructions at the end of your online session on how to contact a representative.
FAQ_LINK_TWO_CONTENT:
(FR)We recommend you file your report on Friday, anytime on Saturday or early on Sunday for weekend processing. Reports are processed for payment by our computer on Sunday, normally after 3 PM.

If you file your reports between Monday and Thursday, they are processed normally after 6 PM.

If you file your reports after the processing time, your report will process on the next business day.

If you are entitled to benefits, your payment is deposited directly to your bank account 2 business days later. If you are unable to use Direct Deposit your payment will be mailed to you.
FAQ_LINK_THREE_TITLE: (FR)What you need to know to file your report
FAQ_LINK_THREE_CONTENT_ONE:
(FR)If you worked during the period covered, you must provide the dates and the number of hours that you have worked, the telephone number of all employers for whom you worked and your total earnings before deductions (including tips and commissions) earned for each calendar week of the period.

You need to report your actual earnings to avoid repayment situations. Remember, you must always declare your earnings before deductions in the week(s) in which they are earned. For example:

* If you have worked in a particular week and will be paid later, you must declare the number of hours worked and earnings before deductions in the week that you actually worked.

* If you have worked in a particular week and will not be paid for it, you must declare the number of hours worked in the week that you actually worked.

When reporting your earnings for each calendar week (Sunday to Saturday) round to the nearest dollar.

* For example if your earnings were $125.49 then enter $125. If your earnings were $125.50 then enter $126.

Report only full hours worked for each calendar week (Sunday to Saturday).

* For example if you worked 38 hours and 15 minutes in a week then enter 38 hours. If you work 38 hours and 45 minutes enter 38 hours.

If you started full time work, you must provide the exact date that you started. You need to report all employment, whether you work for someone else or for yourself. You also need to notify us of any separation from employment and the reason for separation.
FAQ_LINK_THREE_CONTENT_TWO: (FR)If you attended school or training, you must provide us with the number of hours that you were in training and the amount of any training allowance received. Do not include allowances for living away from home, commuting, travel or dependent care.
FAQ_LINK_THREE_CONTENT_THREE:
(FR)If you were unavailable for work (for example, out of the country, on vacation or not looking for work for any reason) or you were incapable of working (illness or injury), you will need to provide the dates. You must also report any absence from your area of residence or any absence from Canada.

You must answer all the questions presented truthfully. Remember that providing false information is considered fraud and is punishable by law. If you make a mistake during your on-line session, you will be able to make corrections before submitting your report. If you discover that you made a mistake after you have submitted your report, it is important that you let us know as soon as possible; otherwise you may have to pay back the benefits you received.

You can contact us:

1. at 1-800-531-7555 during business hours and press 0 to speak to a representative; 2.
in writing to your Service Canada Centre; or
3. in person at your Service Canada Centre.
FAQ_LINK_FOUR_CONTENT:
(FR)The successful submission of your report will be confirmed. At the same time you will also be given the date that your next report is due. Write this date on a calendar as you will not be able to submit your online report before this date.

If you need information about your payment, including deducted amounts and the date of your deposit, visit My Service Canada Account or call the Telephone Information Service, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, at 1-800-206-7218.
FAQ_LINK_FIVE_CONTENT: (FR)If your mailing address or Direct Deposit banking information has changed, login to My Service Canada Account and provide us with this information BEFORE completing your EI report.
QUESTION_ONE_TEXT: Avez-vous déménagé, changé d'adresse postale ou modifié l'information bancaire fournie pour le dépôt direct ?
QUESTION_TWO_TEXT: Étiez-vous à l'extérieur du Canada entre le lundi et le vendredi pendant la période visée par cette déclaration ?
QUESTION_FOUR_TEXT: Avez-vous travaillé ou reçu une rémunération pendant la période visée par cette déclaration ? Ceci inclut un travail pour lequel vous ne serez pas payé ou serez payé plus tard ou un travail autonome y compris un revenu agricole.
QUESTION_FIVE_TEXT: Étiez-vous aux études ou en formation pendant la période visée par cette déclaration ?
QUESTION_SIX_TEXT: Étiez-vous prêt et disposé à travailler, et capable de le faire chaque jour, du lundi au vendredi, pendant chaque semaine de la période visée par cette déclaration ?
QUESTION_SEVEN_TEXT: Avez-vous reçu ou recevrez-vous d'autres sommes d'argent que celles déjà mentionnées pour la période visée par cette déclaration ?
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_TITLE: Bienvenue dans le kit de démarrage Ionic Super Starter
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_DESCRIPTION: Ionic Super Starter est un kit complet pour démarrer sur Ionic. Il repose sur les meilleures pratiques et implémente de nombreux types de pages.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_DESCRIPTION: Assemblez les types de pages désirés et supprimez les autres. Le kit inclut plusieurs mises en page courantes d’applications mobiles, comme les pages de connexion et d’inscription, les onglets et cette page de tutoriel.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_DESCRIPTION: Si vous avez besoin d’aide, consultez le README du Super Starter pour un tutoriel complet.
LOGIN_ERROR: Connexion impossible. Veuillez vérifier les informations de votre compte et réessayer.
SIGNUP_ERROR: Inscription impossible. Veuillez vérifier les informations de votre compte et réessayer.
ISSUE_PAGE_P1_TEXT: (FR)Unfortunately, at this time we are not able to complete your report online
SUBMISSION_P1_TEXT: (FR)Review your answers to all of the questions shown below. If the answers are correct choose I accept. If you wish to change your answers click edit.
SUBMISSION_P2_TEXT: (FR)By clicking I accept you are agreeing to the
SUBMISSION_QUESTION_1: (FR)Have you moved, changed your mailing address or changed the banking information you provided for Direct Deposit purposes?
SUBMISSION_QUESTION_2: (FR)Were you outside Canada between Monday and Friday during the period of this report?
SUBMISSION_QUESTION_4: (FR)Did you work or receive any earnings during the period of this report? This includes work for which you will be paid later, unpaid work, self-employment including farming
SUBMISSION_QUESTION_5: (FR)Did you attend school or a training course during the period of this report?
SUBMISSION_QUESTION_6: (FR)Were you ready, willing and capable of working each day, Monday through Friday during each week of this report?
SUBMISSION_QUESTION_7: (FR)Is there any other money that you have not previously told us about, that you received or will receive for the period of this report?
CONFIRMATION_STATEMENT:
(FR)I declare that the answers provided to the questions on the Employment Insurance online report are true to the best of my knowledge.

I understand this information will be used to determine my eligibility for employment insurance benefits.

I understand the information I have provided is subject to verification and that giving false information for myself or someone other than myself constitutes fraud. I also understand there are penalties for knowingly making false statements.

At the end of your successful online reporting session, you will be advised of the earliest date you can submit your next report. It is important to file your next report within three weeks of the due date; otherwise a loss of benefits may occur.

The information you provide in your report is being collected under the authority of, and will be used for the purpose of administering the Employment Insurance Act.

Please note that by providing and submitting your SIN and Access Code, you will be deemed to have signed your online report.
BY_TAPPING_ACCEPT: (FR)By tapping I Accept, you accept the End-User Licence Agreement
